paper_abstract: We describe in this paper a general algorithm for solving first-order constraints in the theory T of the evaluated trees which is a combination of the theory of finite or infinite trees and the theory of the rational numbers with addition, subtraction and a linear dense order relation. It transforms a first-order formula phi, which can possibly contain free variables, into a disjunction phi of solved formulas which is equivalent in T, without new free variables and such that phi is either true or false or a formula having at least one free variable and being equivalent neither to true nor to false in T.
paper_title: Solving first-order constraints in the theory of the evaluated trees
